sect2.title: Introduction to EsounD
sect2.para: The EsounD package contains the Enlightened Sound Daemon. This is useful for mixing together several digitized audio streams for playback by a single device.

sect2.title: Installation of EsounD
sect2.para: Install EsounD by running the following commands:
If you wish to install the package documentation (man pages have been already installed), copy the docs/esound.ps file and docs/html directory to a desired location on your system.

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --sysconfdir=/etc: This switch puts configuration files in /etc instead of /usr/etc.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Instructions and information about the configuration file is located in the TIPS file in the EsounD source directory.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The EsounD package contains esd, esdcat, esdctl, esdfilt, esdloop, esdmon, esdplay esdrec, esdsample and libesd libraries.

sect3.title: esd
sect3.para: esd is the Enlightened Sound Daemon.

sect3.title: esdcat
sect3.para: esdcat plays a RAW audio stream through the daemon.

sect3.title: esdctl
sect3.para: esdctl controls certain aspects of the sound daemon.

sect3.title: esdloop
sect3.para: esdloop is test scaffolding for sample cache, loop, and free.

sect3.title: esdmon
sect3.para: esdmon outputs the mixed stream from the daemon.

sect3.title: esdplay
sect3.para: esdplay plays the named file on EsoundD.

sect3.title: esdrec
sect3.para: esdrec outputs from the sound device's current input.

sect3.title: esdsample
sect3.para: esdsample is test scaffolding for sample cache, play back, and free.

sect3.title: esd libraries
sect3.para: libesd libraries contain the functions used by esd.
